wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Gould-Porter (4 January 1905 – 2 January 1987) was an English actor who appeared in films and on television and stage. His film and TV career spanned from 1942 to 1977, and although mainly a character actor he is remembered for his part as Captain Greer in Disney's Bedknobs and Broomsticks (1971) and for his reoccurring role as Ravenswood the butler in The Beverley Hillbillies. , He was sometimes credited as Arthur E. Gould-Porter and A. E. Gould-Porter.

response: * Arthur Gould-Porter as Sir Rupert (uncredited), a man with a broken foot who was one of the Doctor's main patients when he was an M.D.

* Arthur Gould-Porter as Captain Ainsley Greer, a British Army captain who comes from HQ in London to inspect the Home Guard and becomes lost in the area. He is constantly running into locals who suspect him of being a Nazi in disguise.

response: *Arthur Gould-Porter – Sir Winston Churchill, Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

He and Parrish then co-starred in the stage farce Petticoat Fever (1944) at the Musart Theatre in Los Angeles. Tickets for the comedy/romance went on sale on September 5,"'Petticoat Fever' Seats Available." Los Angeles Times. Sep. 5, 1944. p. A 9. and the show opened on September 12."Musart Will Present Noted Farce Tomorrow." Los Angeles Times. Sep. 11, 1944. p. 8."Musart Ready With Romance." Los Angeles Times. Sep. 12, 1944. p. A 9. Harvey's role was as the radio operator, Dascom Dinsmore, who rescues crash victims, roles headed by Parrish and Arthur Gould-Porter, after their plane goes down in the cold wastes of Labrador."Crash Launches Musart Comedy." Los Angeles Times. Oct. 8, 1944. p. B 2.
